name: FRigUnit_TwoBoneIKSimplePerItem
doc:
Solves the two bone IK given two bones.
Note: This node operates in world space!

EffectorItem: The name of the effector item (if exists)
PrimaryAxis: The major axis being aligned - along the item
SecondaryAxis: The minor axis being aligned - towards the polevector
SecondaryAxisWeight: Determines how much the secondary axis roll is being applied
PoleVector:
The polevector to use for the IK solver
This can be a location or direction.
PoleVectorKind: The kind of pole vector this is representing - can be a direction or a location
PoleVectorSpace: The space in which the pole vector is expressed
bEnableStretch: If set to true the stretch feature of the solver will be enabled
StretchStartRatio: The ratio where the stretch starts
Weight: The weight of the solver - how much the IK should be applied.
ItemALength:
The length of the first item.
If set to 0.0 it will be determined by the hierarchy
ItemBLength:
The length of the second item.
If set to 0.0 it will be determined by the hierarchy
bPropagateToChildren:
If set to true all of the global transforms of the children
of this bone will be recalculated based on their local transforms.
Note: This is computationally more expensive than turning it off.
ExecuteContext: * This property is used to chain multiple mutable units together
